title: Highest surface area to volume ratio

content.description: Some cells, such as intestinal cells, exchange a lot of material with their surroundings. The surface-to-volume ratio of these cells affects the efficiency of material exchange.
content.question: The table provides measurements of four different eukaryotic cells. Cell 1 2 3 4 Total surface area <math alttext="in square micrometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> 40 60 80 100 Total volume <math alttext="in micrometers cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 20 10 30 20 Based on the data, which cell is likely to be most effective in the exchange of materials?

skill.text: 5.A: Perform mathematical calculations, including: i. mathematical equations in the curriculum ii. means iii. rates iv. ratios v. percentages and percent changes
